EmailTemplate.subject: Pivotal Software: The Time for Digital Transformation is Now
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hello {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
With Velocity 2016 behind us, now is the time to accelerate your digital transformation. It doesn’t matter what industry you’re in—your enterprise has the opportunity to use open source software, Cloud Native platforms, and data analytics to redefine its relationship with customers, develop completely new business models, and drive new levels of profitability and efficiency.
To find out how Pivotal can help you on this journey, please join us in Las Vegas at SpringOne Platform <[[http://springoneplatform.io]]>, August 1–4. SpringOne Platform brings together the people, process and tools for delivering and operating data-driven software services. Whether you are just starting your transformation journey or already delivering at scale, there will be in-depth advanced technical topics and accessible introductory content covering agile methodology, continuous delivery, devops, microservices, data analytics, machine learning, and more. Register today <[[https://2016.event.springoneplatform.io/register]]>.
We also invite you to take advantage of our library of Digital Transformation resources, including:
- Allstate Insurance Podcast - Matt Curry from Allstate, one of the largest US insurers, describes the company’s journey into Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, and Test-driven development with the goal to drive automation all the way through the application lifecycle. Listen <[[http://thenewstack.io/allstates-devops-honeymoon-pivotal-going-strong-one-year-later/]]> - Cloud Native Journey eBook - This digital eBook by Michael Coté <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/author/cote]]> explains how new cloud techniques and technologies can help your business become a software innovation factory. Download <[[http://pivotal.io/embarking-on-the-cloud-native-journey-to-more-agile-it]]> - Microservices Architecture eBook - This eBook by Matt Stine <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/author/mstine]]> helps developers learn how to architect and write cloud native applications, as well as understand how to deploy and manage them. It examines the cultural, organizational, and technical changes necessary to migrate traditional monolithic applications and service-oriented architectures to cloud native architectures. Download <[[http://pivotal.io/platform/migrating-to-cloud-native-application-architectures-ebook]]> - The Cloud Native Platform eBook - This digital eBook by Duncan Winn <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/author/dwinn]]> explains the essential capabilities of a platform needed to support cloud applications and examines the changes enterprises need to make in process, organization, and culture if they are to take advantage of this approach. Download <[[http://pivotal.io/cloud-foundry-the-cloud-native-platform]]>
Now is the time to take the reins of your Digital Transformation. Let’s build something meaningful.
Sincerely,
The Pivotal Team
